page.title: 03IRONFOUNDERS IN BO'NESS
page.content: Ballantine iron works were first started by two brothers in 1836. The first iron works in Bo'ness started in 1750. Bo'ness was a popular place for building iron works because there was both iron ore and coal in Bo'ness. Now there are only two iron companies left. Ballantines is known all over the world because they make fancy railings, lamp posts, gates and drain covers. Some Arabs put in an offer for railings and lamps like the ones at Buckingham Palace and the Mall in London. So the manager went down to London and measured the lamps.
